overview:
Steve O’Hara is a Silicon Valley based entrepreneur. Steve founded three Bay Area based, venture-backed companies and has been an Advisor and Board member to several others.

Steve is currently a Founder of Nebula, an enterprise systems start-up for “big data” cloud computing that was founded in 2011. The company has raised two rounds of capital and is backed by Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Highland Capital Partners, Comcast Ventures and Eric Schmidt’s Innovation Endeavors. Nebula’s other investors include Scott McNealy, Harris Barton, William R. Hearst III and Google’s first three investors – Andy Bechtolsheim, Ram Shriram and David Cheriton.

In 1999, Steve founded metro optical carrier and industry leader OnFiber Communications. Steve founded OnFiber with seed funding from Andy Bechtolsheim, and later incubated the start-up at Kleiner Perkins under Vinod Khosla. OnFiber raised its A, B and C rounds from from Kleiner, Perkins, Caufield & Byers, Bear Stearns and Bechtel. OnFiber was acquired by Qwest (NYSE: Q) in 2006 for $170M.

In 1994, Steve founded CoreLogic with backing from Intel Capital, Mitsubishi and angel investors. CoreLogic was a virtual chip pioneer that designed Reduced Instruction Set Computing (RISC) processors and cores for semiconductor and networking companies. In 1997, CoreLogic merged with another venture-backed start-up, Rendition, and in 1998 Micron Technology (NYSE: MU) acquired the combined company for $90MM.

Steve started his career at Nortel (NYSE: NRTLQ) in 1988 and worked at the company through 1994. He held roles in applications engineering, sales and business development.

Steve was the founding Advisor to NetScreen (IPO in 2001, acquired by Juniper Networks in 2004 for $4.6 billion), an Advisor to SiByte (acquired by Broadcom in 2001 for $2.1 billion), an Advisor to Infinera (IPO in 2007 Nasdaq: INFN) and an Advisor to EuPhonics (acquired by 3Com in 1998). Steve also served on the Board of Directors at Acclaim Communications, which is now part of Intel.

Steve currently serves on the Advisory Board at Santa Clara University’s School of Engineering.

In 2004 Steve was a finalist for Ernst & Young’s annual Entrepreneur of the Year.

Steve graduated from Santa Clara University in 1988 with a BS degree in Math. He lives in the San Francisco Bay Area and in Ketchum, Idaho.
